text: Daniel’s Vision of Four Beasts and the Son of Man

In the first year of Belshazzar the king of Babylon, Daniel saw a dream and visions\f + \fr 7:1 \ft Or “the visions” \f* of his head \add as he lay\add* on his bed; then he wrote down the dream \add and\add* \add the\add* ⸤summary⸥\f + \fr 7:1 \ft Literally “head” \f* of \add the\add* words ⸤as follows⸥:\f + \fr 7:1 \ft Literally “saying” \f*
Daniel ⸤explained⸥\f + \fr 7:2 \ft Literally “answered” \f* and said, “I was looking in my vision in the night, and look, the four winds of heaven were stirring \add up\add* the great sea.
And four great beasts \add were\add* coming up from the sea, differing ⸤from one another⸥.\f + \fr 7:3 \ft Literally “this from this” \f*

The first \add was\add* like \add a\add* lion and ⸤had⸥\f + \fr 7:4 \ft Literally “for him/it” \f* \add the\add* wings of an eagle. I was watching until its wings were plucked off, and it was lifted up from the earth and it was raised on \add its\add* feet like a human, and a human heart was given to it.

And look, another beast, a second one, looking like a bear. And it was raised up on one side and three tusks\f + \fr 7:5 \ft Or “ribs” \f* \add were\add* in its mouth between its teeth, and so ⸤it was told⸥,\f + \fr 7:5 \ft Literally “they were saying” \f* “Arise, eat much flesh!”

After this I was watching and look, another \add beast\add* like a leopard; ⸤it had four wings⸥\f + \fr 7:6 \ft Literally “and \fq there were \ft to it four wings” \f* of a bird on its back, and ⸤the beast had⸥\f + \fr 7:6 \ft Literally “to the beast” \f* four heads, and dominion was given to it.

After this in the visions of the night I was looking and there was a fourth beast, terrifying and frightful and exceedingly strong, and ⸤it had⸥\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Literally “\fq were \ft to it” \f* ⸤great iron teeth⸥,\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Literally “teeth of iron for it great” \f* \add and it was\add* devouring and crushing, and it stamped the remainder\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Or “residue” \f* with its feet; and it was different from all \add the other\add* beasts ⸤that preceded it⸥\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Literally “that preceding her/it” \f* ⸤and it had ten horns⸥.\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Literally “and ten horns for her/it” \f*

I was considering the horns, and look, another little horn came up ⸤among⸥\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Literally “between” \f* them, and three of the earlier horns ⸤were rooted out⸥\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Literally “dehorned” \f* from before it, and there were eyes like the eyes of \add a\add* human\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Or “humankind” \f* in this horn and \add also\add* a mouth \add that was\add* speaking boastfully.

“⸤I continued watching⸥\f + \fr 7:9 \ft Literally “I was watching” \f* until thrones were placed and an Ancient of Days sat; his clothing \add was\add* like white snow and the hair of his head \add was\add* like pure wool and his throne \add was\add* a flame\f + \fr 7:9 \ft Or “ablaze with” \f* of fire and its wheels\f + \fr 7:9 \ft Aramaic “wheel” \f* \add were\add* burning fire.

A stream of fire issued forth and flowed ⸤from his presence⸥;\f + \fr 7:10 \ft Literally “from before him” \f* thousands \add upon\add* thousands served him and ten thousand \add upon\add* ten thousand stood before him. The judge sat, and \add the\add* books were opened.

“⸤I continued watching⸥\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Literally “I was watching” \f* then\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Aramaic “in then” \f* because of the noise of the boastful words of the horn \add who was\add* speaking; ⸤I continued watching⸥\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Literally “I was watching” \f* until the beast was slain and its body was destroyed, and it was given \add over\add* to burning with fire.

And \add as for\add* the remainder of the beasts, ⸤their dominion was taken away⸥,\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Literally “they took away their dominion” \f* but a prolongation ⸤of their life⸥\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Literally “in life” \f* was given to them for a season and a time.

“⸤I continued watching⸥\f + \fr 7:13 \ft Literally “I was watching” \f* in the visions of the night, and look, with the clouds of heaven \add one\add* like a son of man\f + \fr 7:13 \ft Or “mortal,” or “son of humankind” \f* was coming, and he came to the Ancient of Days, and ⸤was presented⸥\f + \fr 7:13 \ft Literally “they presented him” \f* before him.

And to him was given dominion and glory and kingship that\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Aramaic “and” \f* all the peoples, the nations, and languages \add would\add* serve him; his dominion \add is\add* a dominion ⸤without end⸥\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Literally “of eternity” \f* that will not cease, and his kingdom \add is one\add* that will not be destroyed.
Daniel Explains and Interprets the Vision
“⸤As for me, Daniel⸥,\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Literally “I Daniel” \f* my spirit was troubled ⸤within me⸥,\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Literally “in the midst of sheath” \f* and the visions of my head terrified me.

\add So\add* I approached one of the attendants and I asked him\f + \fr 7:16 \ft Aramaic “from him” \f* \add about\add* the truth concerning all this; and he told me\f + \fr 7:16 \ft Aramaic “to me” \f* \add that\add* he would make known to me the explanation of the matter.
‘These great beasts which are four \add in number\add* \add are\add* four kings \add who\add* will arise from the earth.

But the holy ones\f + \fr 7:18 \ft Or “saints” \f* of the Most High will receive the kingdom, and they will take possession of the kingdom forever, ⸤forever and ever⸥.’\f + \fr 7:18 \ft Literally “forever and to forever” \f*

“Then I desired to make certain concerning the fourth beast that was different from ⸤all the others⸥\f + \fr 7:19 \ft Literally “all \fq of \ft them” \f*—exceedingly terrifying, with its iron teeth and its claws of bronze; it devoured and crushed \add and\add* stamped the remainder with its feet—

and concerning the horns that \add were\add* on its head, and \add concerning\add* \add the\add* other \add horn\add* that came up and ⸤before which three horns fell⸥,\f + \fr 7:20 \ft Literally “and fell from before it three” \f* and this horn ⸤had eyes⸥\f + \fr 7:20 \ft Literally “and eyes to it” \f* and \add a\add* mouth speaking ⸤boastfully⸥,\f + \fr 7:20 \ft Literally “abundantly” \f* and its appearance \add was\add* larger than its companions.
⸤I continued watching⸥,\f + \fr 7:21 \ft Literally “I was watching” \f* and this horn made war with \add the\add* holy ones\f + \fr 7:21 \ft Or “saints” \f* and it prevailed over them,

until the Ancient of Days came and gave judgment to \add the\add* holy ones\f + \fr 7:22 \ft Or “saints” \f* of \add the\add* Most High; and the time arrived and \add the\add* holy ones\f + \fr 7:22 \ft Or “saints” \f* took possession of the kingdom.

“And he said, ‘The fourth beast \add is\add* the fourth kingdom \add that\add* will be on the earth that will be different from all the \add other\add* kingdoms, and it will devour the whole earth and it will trample it and it will crush it.

And \add as for\add* the ten horns \add coming\add* from it, \add from\add* this kingdom\f + \fr 7:24 \ft Or “the kingdom” \f* ten kings will arise, and another will arise after them. And he will be different from the earlier \add ones\add*, and he will subdue three kings.

And he will speak words against the Most High, and he will wear out \add the\add* holy ones\f + \fr 7:25 \ft Or “saints” \f* of the Most High, and he will attempt to change times and law, and they will be given into his hand for a time and two times and half a time.
Then the court will sit, and his dominion will be removed,\f + \fr 7:26 \ft Or “taken away” \f* to be eradicated and to be destroyed ⸤totally⸥.\f + \fr 7:26 \ft Literally “until the end” \f*

And the kingdom and the dominion and the greatness of the kingdoms under the whole heaven will be given to \add the\add* nation of \add the\add* holy ones\f + \fr 7:27 \ft Or “saints” \f* of the Most High; his kingdom ⸤is an everlasting kingdom⸥,\f + \fr 7:27 \ft Literally “\fq is \ft a kingdom of eternity” \f* and all the dominions will serve and obey him.’

⸤This is the end of the account⸥.\f + \fr 7:28 \ft Literally “Up to here \fq is \ft the end of the account” \f* ⸤As for me, Daniel⸥\f + \fr 7:28 \ft Literally “I Daniel” \f*—my thoughts terrified me greatly and my face changed over me, but I kept the matter in my heart.”\f + \fr 7:28 \ft Or “to myself” \f*
